#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Navigate Pixiv
#Text=Pixiv is a popular Japanese website that serves as a place for artists to showcase their work .
#Text=Top Japanese artists place their work on here for a variety of franchises , including some original works of their own .
#Text=Be wary , however ; mature artwork is allowed on this website , and sometimes may not be tagged as mature by accident .
#Text=This article will show you how to browse the website with minimum fuss .
#Text=No account is needed , but a translator is recommended .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Bring up the website .
#Text=Bring up Pixiv by searching for it through a search engine .
#Text=You can use Google , Bing , or anyone you like .
#Text=You can also use the hyperlink www.pixiv.net to jump directly to the website .
#Text=Begin searching .
#Text=On the top , you will find the search bar .
#Text=This bar is your gateway to the larger site .
#Text=Start with an English-language tag , as this can will help you find the more populated tags .
#Text=Alternatively , you can look for the Japanese terminology of whatever you ’re searching for and put that into the search bar .
#Text=Then , when you have your term , press to search .
#Text=Examine the art .
#Text=This is where you can find the artwork on Pixiv .
#Text=Up top , you will notice some “ tags . ”
#Text=These can link to other subjects which could be of interest to you .
#Text=Click on a picture to view the image , and click on the bottom numbers to see more images .
#Text=View the artwork .
#Text=When you click on a picture , you will be presented with the above screen .
#Text=This displays a miniature preview of the artist ’s work .
#Text=The “ Submitted Works ” section includes other work by the artist , while the “ Bookmarked Works ” section includes work the artist likes and recommends to others .
#Text=Tips

#Text=There are two kinds of tags on Pixiv : franchise tags , which represent the franchise the art belongs to ( represented by figure 1 in the image ) ; and image tags , which serve as definition of themes of the picture , of which up to 10 exist ( represented by figure 2 in the image ) .
#Text=This is where the internet translation program comes in .
#Text=You can use this to find out what the tag means if you do n’t know yourself .
#Text=Click on a tag to begin browsing .
#Text=If you click on the name of the artist , you will see their page .
#Text=This lists just about all the work the artist has submitted to the website .
#Text=You can also find their bookmarks , works the artist has liked , and who they follow , as well as the artists they recommend .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Pixiv does not have any limits on what content can be submitted , and while most pornography is filtered , some of it is not .
#Text=Be very careful when you are browsing , especially for popular topics .
